div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: During these uncertain times, it is okay to feel angry, stressed, scared, anxious, bored, sad, nothing or any other emotion! Your feelings are valid, and they may change from day to day, moment to moment.
Your child may also experience many different emotions as well. You can help by carefully listening to their thoughts and feelings, and responding with truth and reassurance.
See the Mental Health Resource page for support for your child or family.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc

h2.div: Tips for Managing Anxiety Around COVID-19

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

ul.li: Talk with family and friends about other topics
Engage in relaxing and calming activities
Stay focused on the present rather than trying to predict the future

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-II5mzb pSzOP-AhqUyc-II5mzb jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

ul.li: Fact sheet for coping with stress
Tips for helping your child and family cope with COVID-19
Workbook to help kids cope with their feelings
